author: dwright
title: John Terry sent off on his Chelsea comeback in FA Cup clash with Peterborough
text:
John Terry sent off on his Chelsea comeback in FA Cup clash with Peterborough 
Blues captain sees red for a professional foul on first start since October Breaking By DUNCAN WRIGHT 8th January 2017, 4:32 pm JOHN TERRY was sent off for a professional foul on his first Chelsea start since October. 
Chelsea captain Terry saw red for a professional foul on Peteborough’s Lee Angol in the FA Cup clash at Stamford Bridge. Reuters John Terry was sent off for a professional foul on Lee Angol Reuters 4 John Terry was sent off on his Chelsea return against Peterborough 
Terry has struggled to force his way into Antonio Conte’s side this season and has been restricted to rare appearances in cup competitions. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The former England captain had been hoping to make an impression with a strong display in the third round match againsty Peterborough. Reuters Chelsea captain John Terry pleads his innocence to referee Kevin Friend Rex Features 4 Kevin Friend sends John Terry off in the FA Cup clash with Peterborough 
But he saw red after 67 minutes – his first starting appearance since he was part of the Chelsea side who lost to West Ham in the EFL Cup in October. 
Chelsea were leading the game 3-0 against their League One opposition when Terry was given his marching orders. 
And the minnows soon capitalised as they pulled a goal back through Tom Nicholls – only for Pedro to end any hopes of a comeback by adding a fourth goal for the Blues within three minutes. more from football 'WHO WOULD YOU GET WET WITH?'
